chunks.translated_text:
**Breaking Through the Inexhaustible Treasury**

Break through the Inexhaustible Treasury,
leap beyond the pass of passion’s chain.

**Love and Desire**

Love and desire—floating clouds that veil the radiant sun,
frost-laden winds that wither autumn’s orchid.
If love and desire remain uncast,
how can the heart’s lord find peace again?

**Temptation’s Blind**

Temptation’s blind may lure the pheasant,
profit and desire corrode the mind.
Within the cinnabar field lies a numinous thing—
neglect it, and thorns will rise and bind.

**Worldly Affairs**

Worldly affairs know no bounds,
household cares stretch endlessly.
If you seek no place of rest,
when will toil ever cease to be?

**Purity**

Purity is the true and natural state,
adapting to all, it enters the divine.
No need to blow the warming breath—
the frozen valley revives to spring on its own.

**Graying Temples**

Graying temples speckled white,
crimson complexion fades to sere.
No one asks of age’s call—
what excuse can you interpose?

**Birth and Death**

Dwelling within the gate of birth and death,
walking the path of rebirth’s wheel.
This heart grows accustomed to its comings and goings—
how could it pause to ask what lies ahead?

**Accumulated Dust**

Accumulated dust—dim and bleak,
the long night—black and vast.
Before the Three Essentials are grasped,
how can the Five Senses be made right?

**Yin and Yang**

Yin and Yang are the great craftsmen,
Heaven and Earth the potter’s wheel.
Transforming, they change with the times,
pursuing life, they renew each day.

**The Great Dao**

The Great Dao is profound and obscure,
misguided men seek it upside-down.
It is not far from the self at all—
only the original heart remains.

**Colophon to *Cloud and Mountain Collection*, Volume Four**
Composed by Perceiver of the Constant, the Realized One, Ji Zhizhen.

chunks.translated_text:
**Colophon to *Seven Perfected Ones’ Portraits***

To capture the true likeness in painting—
this is reverence, this is devotion.
Yet of this very visage,
what else could I imitate?

The supreme lineage masters
bear no dual aspect.
The moon’s reflection in a thousand rivers—
one luminous roundness, undivided.

Primordial and indestructible,
their true forms remain unchanged.
Who has beheld them? Who has transmitted them?
All dwell beneath Heaven yet fathom not its height,
all tread the Earth yet exhaust not its depth.

Neither ancient nor modern,
neither fleeting nor enduring.
Tracing the source, following close—yet the steps never cease;
racing ahead, leaving all dust behind—yet gazing back in vain.

Kuang Qu, wishing to speak, forgets his words;
Ji Xian, self-lost, flees.
Li Zhu wipes his eyes yet sees no trace,
the Yellow Emperor listens to Ying yet discerns no right or wrong.

The formless seeks them in nothingness,
the fleeting carves them into being.
Connoisseurs strain their minds in vain,
sophists seal their lips in silence.

Gazing at the vastness, one sighs toward Ruo—
how could mere brush and ink presume to stain them?

**Lyrics by Perfected One of Knowing the Constant, Ji Zhizhen**

**Jade Terrace, First Tier**

A speck of primordial true-qi veiled by deluded thoughts,
summons forth an illusory body.
Mayfly and morning mushroom, fleeting passions and perceptions,
entangled in the clouds of habit’s confusion.

A thousand-zhang pit of fire, its snare ever poised—
ten thousand deceptions in swirling yellow dust and white waves.
Spread wantonly, sinking into filth’s mire,
drowning in the bitter sea’s depths.

So tangled—
life and death, gain and loss,
right and wrong, glory and shame, all cling to suffering’s wheel.
Yet sometimes awakening comes: the block of ignorance shatters,
the eye’s aperture widens like a wheel.

The pearl of nature pierces through—
then one trusts the treasuring light,
encompassing heaven and earth.
From this, the spirit communes of itself:
a celestial realm where night never falls,
a grotto-heaven of eternal spring.

**Mu Lan Hua Man**

Sun-crow and moon-hare race,
darting in and out swift as shuttles.
More still—the shadow-play of floating life,
puppets on strings of illusion,
manipulated by stern hands.

Breaths of praise and blame shift forms in ceaseless flux,
stirring up a storm from flat ground.
All mere fly-heads and snail-horns,
yet through the ages, churned like madness.

Wasted time—
awakened with a start, the dust-dream shatters,
laughing hee-hee.
Realizing the original, primal beginning,
the numinous clarity remains—
neither less nor more.

No need to hoard or stain further:
facing wild clouds and stream-water,
sing mountain songs.
Beneath the moon, walking alone,
staff bearing rain-hat and misty straw cloak.

**Second**

Mocking the illusions of this life,
encountering desolation—
the world’s path a sheep’s gut,
human hearts like ginger roots,
hardness turned to softness.

Frenzied, white ants battle in drunken fury,
seeking marquisate shadows in locust and sandalwood.
One awakens—yellow millet still uncooked,
a hundred years of light vanish like smoke.

Pursuing—
past and present, ancient and now,
what has been achieved? All mere towers of nothing.
Examining wealth and honor as floating clouds,
merit and fame as painted cakes,
this floating life a retching emptiness.

Clearly seen as false before the eyes—
then with one blade, severed in two,
no longer swept along the current.
Leaping free from the waves of delusion’s ford,
the moonlit boat returns across the blue sea.

the fleeting carves them into being.
Connoisseurs strain their minds in vain,
sophists seal their lips in silence.

Gazing at the vastness, one sighs toward Ruo—
how could mere brush and ink presume to stain them?

*Cloud and Mountain Collection, Volume Four—End*

chunks.original_text: 选峰峦佳处，结茅屋，伴苍松。 有药圃芝田，耕云钓月，香蔼灵风。 凭栏俯观寰海，鼓洪涛、千丈接长空。 几度蓬莱清浅，杳冥淆混鱼龙。 三山圣种犹存，聋瞽辈，觅无纵。 笑阿母蟠桃，安期遗枣，诱引儿童。 任公巨缁好在，辖钩悬、五十引长虹。 蹲坐三年不见，若鱼何日相逢。 水龙昤 万尘诸累重重，一时颖脱如悬解。 青鞋拄杖，鹑衣百纳，沿身轻快。 南北束西，浪萍风梗，去留何碍。 许昂簪笑傲，行歌立舞，萦心事、无纤芥。 不问壶天境界。 更谁分、区中方外。 如云似水，优游散诞，纵横自在。 转首襟期，世绿空幻，到头终坏。 待他时兴尽，云霞堆裹，结无为会。 其二 此身幸脱尘樊累，宜更选清冻地。 山灵招我，峰屏岫幌，回环凝翠。 白石清泉，竹轩松径，草堂林际。 拣凭高稳处，储风养月，更谁问、人问世。 压尽壶天景致。 笑桃源、落花流水。 个中时复，灵仙高会，彩云摇曳。 谈笑沧淇，几番尘土，劫灰弹指。 倒金壶碧酒，鲸波一吸，且陶陶醉。 其三 古今兴废存亡，落花满地香风扫。 茫茫苦海，洪波千丈，无穷胶扰。 俱在天真，浪游尘境，执迷颠倒。 自玄都别后，流离宛转，谁更问、长安道。 但念功名未了。 聚愁眉、苦萦怀抱。 几时会得，三田灵秀，活人芝草。 霞彩云英，竹风松月，药炉丹宠。 炼深根固蒂，长生久视，永无衰老。 酹江月 初机学道，道无形、着脚如何踪迹。 只在灵源方寸地，体正元初端的。 激浊扬清，明真削伪，扫荡诸邪僻。 迷l 云消散，密通方外虚实。 主人堂上无为，环枢应运，不许纤尘及。 径入无何真境界，明秀高峰玉立。 瑞气冲融，祥光赫奕，忘尽尘樊质。 逍逼游宴，寿同高厚无极。 其二 梦中骇鹿，戏浮生、得失悲欢离合。 见解分明犹是梦，转转昏沉难觉。 鸡口人情，羊肠世路，各自争头角。 挥鞭举棹，一般职脸行脚。 有日猛省心灰，尘樊识破，方信从前错。 林下山问安稳地，云水无情相约。 自在时光，逍遥日月，脱尽拘束缚。 槐南枝上，玲看黄蚁行乐。 其三 功名富贵，似无绳、缚尽英雄豪杰。 古往今来同影戏，顷刻存亡兴灭。 罗绮妻学，画堂金玉，招感人窥窃。 繁华粒点，大都多少时节。 自造恶业重重，头皮改换，苦楚经多劫。 争似抽身闻早省，时把狂心休歇。 世网冲开，玄关拨转，自得真仙诀。 功成归去，一轮江上明月。 喜迁莺 欲明真趣。
chunks.translated_text:
At peaks of finest beauty,
thatched huts are raised,
companions to verdant pines.
With herb gardens and lingzhi fields,
plowing clouds and angling moon,
fragrant mists and sacred winds arise.

Leaning on the rail to gaze upon the mortal sea,
drumming waves a thousand fathoms high
merge with the boundless sky.
How oft have Penglai’s shallows blurred,
where dragons and depths confound.

The sacred seeds of Three Mountains yet remain,
while the deaf and blind seek without cease.
Mocking Queen Mother’s peaches,
Anqi’s left-behind jujubes,
lures for mere children.
Ren Gong’s great black carp still thrives,
its hook suspended,
fifty spans of rainbow drawn.
Squatting unseen for three years—
when shall the fish-like one appear?

**Shuilong Yin**

Myriad dust-laden burdens, layer upon layer,
all at once shed like a knot untied.
Blue shoes and staff,
patched cloak of quail feathers,
light and swift upon the body.
North and south, east and west,
a drifting duckweed, wind-tossed twig—
what hinders going or staying?
Permitted to lift the hairpin in laughter,
to sing while walking, dance while standing,
no trifling cares to cling to the heart.

No inquiry into the realm of Pot Heaven.
Who then distinguishes
the mundane from the beyond?
Like clouds, like water,
wandering freely, unconstrained,
roaming at will.
In a turn of thought, worldly aspirations—
all green illusions—
crumble to ruin in the end.
Wait until that time when interest wanes,
amid clouds and rosy mists,
to convene the assembly of non-action.

**Second**

This body, fortunate to escape the snares of dust,
should seek a place of pure seclusion.
Mountain spirits beckon me,
peaks like screens, ridges like curtains,
encircling verdant hues.
White stones and limpid springs,
bamboo pavilions and pine-lined paths,
grass halls at the forest’s edge.
Choosing a steadfast height,
storing wind and nurturing moon—
who then inquires of the human world?

Surpassing all the wonders of Pot Heaven,
mocking Peach Blossom Spring’s
fallen petals and flowing waters.
Here, at times, divine immortals gather,
colored clouds swaying.
Laughing over the azure waves,
how many turns of dust and ashes
vanish in a snap of the fingers?
Tipping the golden flask of jade wine,
a whale’s draught swallowed whole—
drunk in blissful intoxication.

**Third**

Rise and fall, survival and ruin through the ages,
fallen blossoms strewn, fragrant winds sweeping.
Vast the bitter sea,
waves a thousand fathoms high,
endless entanglements.
All lost in pristine innocence,
adrift in the dusty realm,
clinging in delusion and folly.
Since parting from the Mystic Capital,
wandering and turning,
who now asks of the Chang’an road?

Only the thought of unfinished merit and fame
gathers brows in sorrow,
bitterly entwining the heart.
When shall the three fields’ numinous splendor
and life-giving lingzhi herbs be attained?
Rosy clouds and jade essences,
bamboo winds and pine moon,
the alchemical furnace and elixir’s grace.
Refining deep roots and firm stems,
to attain long life and enduring vision,
forever free from decay.

**Leijiang Yue**

At the outset of Dao-learning,
the Dao has no form—
how then to tread its traces?
Only within the numinous source, the square inch of the heart,
embodying the primal truth of the original beginning.
Stirring the turbid to reveal the pure,
illuminating the real and excising the false,
sweeping away all perversities.
Delusive clouds disperse,
secretly connecting the void and full beyond the mundane.

The master in the hall practices non-action,
the pivot of the cosmos turns,
not permitting the slightest dust to approach.
Directly entering the true realm of Nothing-Whatsoever,
radiant and jade-like, towering peaks stand.
Auspicious qi surges and harmonizes,
propitious light blazes resplendent,
all dust-laden qualities forgotten.
Roaming and feasting at ease,
life as boundless as heaven and earth.

**Second**

The startled deer in dreams,
playing with this floating life—
gains and losses, joys and sorrows, partings and meetings.
Even clear discernment is but a dream,
ever turning, ever sunk in stupor.
The chicken’s beak of human sentiment,
the sheep’s gut of worldly paths,
each vying for prominence.
Wielding the whip, raising the oar—
all the same, trudging on official roads.

One day, sudden awakening, the heart turned to ashes,
the snares of dust seen through,
only then believing past errors.
In the tranquil land beneath the pines,
clouds and waters make an emotionless pact.
Time at ease,
days and months carefree,
all bonds cast off.
On the southern branch of the locust tree,
watching the yellow ants at their revels.

**Third**

Merit and fame, wealth and honor,
like an untethered rope,
binding all heroes and stalwarts.
From ancient times to now, a shadow play—
in an instant, survival and ruin, rise and fall.
Silken wives and learned sons,
painted halls and golden jades,
luring men to covet and steal.
Fleeting splendor, mere specks—
how long do they last?

Creating heavy karmic ills,
changing the very skin of the head,
enduring bitter trials through countless kalpas.
How much better to withdraw early, to awaken in time,
to rest the mad heart at last.
Breaking through the world’s net,
turning the Mystic Pass,
attaining the true immortal’s formula.
When the work is complete, returning—
a bright moon over the river.

**Xiqian Ying**

To illuminate the true essence.
chunks.overlap_context:
llet still uncooked,
a hundred years of light vanish like smoke.

Pursuing—
past and present, ancient and now,
what has been achieved? All mere towers of nothing.
Examining wealth and honor as floating clouds,
merit and fame as painted cakes,
this floating life a retching emptiness.

Clearly seen as false before the eyes—
then with one blade, severed in two,
no longer swept along the current.
Leaping free from the waves of delusion’s ford,
the moonlit boat returns across the blue sea.

chunks.translated_text:
**Water Melody**

Sweeping away the myriad distractions,
the lost sheep’s forked paths.
Shedding the skin and fur,
only the true remains,
utterly forsaking past steps.
A jade lotus unfurls,
untouched by the slightest dust.
Gathering crimson snow,
drinking the dark frost as before,
the elixir of spirit gathers in perfection.
Now free from doubt,
alone in the emerald haze,
planting the rootless tree by hand.
The luminous qi spans the sky,
the numinous source bathes in moonlight,
radiance spreading in an instant.
Ten thousand bushels of pearls cannot compare—
firmly guarded, securely stored.
Spirits cannot fathom,
demons cannot summon,
when merit is complete, mounting the phoenix to depart.

---

**Water Melody (Second)**

Seated in idleness, a stubborn habit,
what more could cloud and stream offer?
The heart’s raiment washed clean of dust,
another fine livelihood unfolds.
No need to choose—
whether the immortal courts of Yingzhou,
or the bustling streets of flowers and willows—
everywhere, radiance abounds.
Ask not of dragon and tiger,
of white snow or yellow sprout.

No indulgence in poetry,
no chatter of wine,
no plucking of blossoms.
The original face is the public affair—
why boast to others?
By day, gazing upon the old mountain’s scenes,
by night, covered by the stars of the dark sky,
a hundred patches shroud the clouds.
Neither spirits nor ghosts can fathom—
in an instant, filling the rivers and sands.

chunks.translated_text:
**Water Melody (Third)**

Dredging the deepest pockets,
not a single coin to find.
All along, the livelihood of this life
has never mixed with the vulgar.
Like the sages deep in drink,
sobering the muddled heart’s intoxication,
with eyes like jade, gazing upon the mortal realm.
Severing the chains of profit and fame,
trampling the gates of death and life.

Feigning folly,
letting laziness loose,
indulging in play.
The six senses drag not forth—
nestled in the hollow, resting in the groove.
Yet there are extraordinary means:
gathering a slice of empty space,
so clear it chills the night’s radiance.
Grasp the meaning within—
why ask of the Three Mountains?

---

**Water Melody (Fourth)**

Rise and fall perused in green histories,
glory and disgrace a dream of yellow millet.
Fleeting as flowers, swift as lightning—
foolishly chasing, like one gone mad.
Adding feet to a painted snake,
unaware of the monkey’s taro ruse,
both sorrow and joy forgotten.
Turning back to the old homeland,
all its scenes now desolate.

A hundred years of this body—
a snap of the fingers, temples turned to frost.
If others ask, pay no heed,
bear it all in steadfast stillness.
On quiet nights, wind soft and moon bright,
facing cloud companions and rosy friends,
laughter and talk stretch long.
A bowl of heart-cleansing tea,
a petal of incense from before the kalpas.

---

**Water Melody (Fifth)**

A wanderer in foreign lands,
trampling the soft red dust.
Returning, every door and courtyard,
bamboo blinds rolled at dusk.
North and south, east and west—
how many straw sandals worn thin,
yet where to seek the root of heaven?
Ask what radiance remains—
since ancient times, the treasure alone endures.

Entering the realm of nothingness,
roaming the great desert,
crossing Kunlun’s peaks.
That message of the wind immortal—
not to be heard lightly.
Eyes dazzled by falling blossoms,
the osmanthus moon still round as ever,
piercing water without a trace.
Yet relying on the mighty Peng,
high above, it sweeps the clouds from the ridge.

---

**Remembering Elder Fayu, the Spring Patriarch**

Meeting a friend of like mind,
eyes meeting, a bond like gold and orchid.
Climbing the heavens, wandering through mist,
in perfect accord—
chicken and millet unneeded.
Often recalling beneath the *Kun Kun* Pavilion,
gazing down at the vast, boundless sea,
waving the whisk, laughing in conversation.
Rosy clouds rolled up north of Zhenyang,
clouds veiled the face of Crane Mountain.

Years pass,
affairs change,
suddenly the pact grows cold.
Straw sandals and cassia staff remain,
only the memory of knocking at the mystery’s gate.
Wishing the heart as round as the moon,
inside and out, empty and clear,
silently turning the pivot.
A single point, no difference—
a thousand miles shared in the same gaze.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (First) – Exhorting Magistrate Liu**

Dazzling eyes with empty flowers,
all tangled in ropes, bound tight.
Drowned in heaps of soft red dust,
mistaking it for true joy.
The two Lu brothers forgot their later troubles,
the two Shu officials—who saw first?
Dreaming souls follow ants to the locust court—
when will they awaken?

Rise and fall—
once witnessed, let it be.
Prosperity’s bloom
will fade and scatter.
No need for others’ urging—
best to ponder for oneself.
An ancient mirror, polished, reveals realms beyond dust,
a Sui pearl, vainly strummed to scare the eaves’ sparrows.
When enlightenment comes, turn back to the path ahead—
a pact with Penglai.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (Second)**

Rosy friends gathered,
cloud chambers met—
laughing, talking of true rest.
Amidst sweltering skies, light sweat,
hard to endure in stillness.
Ice and jade freshly set on the table,
the dark and mysterious seated, chilling the mat.
Moon cakes, from time to time, floated in golden cups,
swallowed in whale-like gulps.

Dispelling heat,
cleansing the chest.
A power most wondrous,
a divine force.
Laughing at Lu Dongbin’s windy tastes,
Zhao Zhou’s tea-side demeanor.
The Dharma realm, so clear, can be cupped in the hands,
the spirit’s vastness, boundless, light without end.
Ask of the true flavor within—
the mouth cannot speak it, yet the essence is known.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (Third)**

Ten thousand treatises, a thousand sutras—
all perused, seeking true awakening.
Testing ancient and modern deeds,
shifting to mere words, all jumbled.
Not forged within the heart,
through countless kalpas, empty and lost.
Grasping the original truth—
the spirit’s mouth cannot speak it,
where to learn?

Nothing at all,
utterly empty.
Ever pure, ever vast,
pervading the boundless.
Apply effort to nurture,
no need for reckless abandon.
Who can harmonize with the white snow and spring sun?
Village songs and festival wine vie in clamor.
See how many know the ox’s hair—
as rare as the qilin’s horn.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (Fourth)**

A hundred refinings, a thousand temperings—
what is achieved?
A heart like ice and snow.
Amidst piles of accumulated dust, shedding it all,
to reveal the moon of the mind.
Probing the root’s source to the very bottom,
no need to distinguish waves and branches.
Throughout the world, who is not a traveler?
Why speak of it?

The elixir should be secret,
the pouch tightly sealed.
Dwelling without a house,
traveling without a trace.
No more thoughts of self and others,
right and wrong, good and bad.
The parrot in the carved cage speaks,
the cuckoo on the branch sheds blood in vain.
Facing the carriages and horses of profit and fame,
the soft red dust—
guard the tongue well.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (Fifth)**

A stubborn heart—
what towering folly,
endless arising and ceasing.
Driven by the mechanisms of transformation,
so much confusion and salt.
Piling bones like mountains—what is achieved?
Delusion’s sea—hard to transcend.
Alas, the primordial spirit long buried,
entombed in kalpas of dust and sand.

Seeking liberation—
must be fierce.
Finding wise friends,
discussing ice and snow.
Apply effort to polish,
until life’s light shines clear.
Wind still, waves calm—the pond’s depths revealed,
clouds part, the moon of the sky’s heart emerges.
Ask the mute man how honey tastes—
no words to speak.

---

**Slow Song of the Red River (Sixth)**

Lost through many lives,
endless red dust veiling the eyes.
Though painstakingly seeking subtle understanding,
the form cannot bear the strain.
The monkey fondles the moon in the pond,
the fool chews the honey on the blade’s edge.
Pitiful—
entangled in the net of Dharma,
when will it end?

A swallow’s stone treasured,
a bronze plate’s sun.
Tossing jujubes,
floating duckweed.
Break through this mass—
naturally, the message will flow.
Sever the creeping vines of idle entanglement,
shatter the mad traces of the valley’s echoes.
Return to the original point—
in an instant, bear it all,
the true essence.

---

**Court of a Myriad Flowers – For the Perfect Realization**
chunks.overlap_context:

or the bustling streets of flowers and willows—
everywhere, radiance abounds.
Ask not of dragon and tiger,
of white snow or yellow sprout.

No indulgence in poetry,
no chatter of wine,
no plucking of blossoms.
The original face is the public affair—
why boast to others?
By day, gazing upon the old mountain’s scenes,
by night, covered by the stars of the dark sky,
a hundred patches shroud the clouds.
Neither spirits nor ghosts can fathom—
in an instant, filling the rivers and sands.

chunks.original_text: 全本无亏，真元不妄，从来何少何多。 灵源亘古，天地与同科。 素染诸缘万境，生情识、招致辜魔。 难超越，虚生浪死，苦海任奔彼。 、聪明求出离，回机一念，决证无何。 勘元初本有，些子般讹。 应现头头总是，分明在、依旧山河。 高悬鉴，又还打破，拍手笑呵呵。 其二　李老先生庆八十 南极储祥，少微呈瑞，八旬应现人寰。 水云疏－散，金鼎炼神丹。 骯尽长春洞府，逍遥占、物外高闲。 无衰老，龟旋鹤绕，相对且怡颜。 殷恋重梼祝，温炉担灶，劫外旗檀。 念亘初容貌，不许凋残。 通古今如旦暮，蟠桃见、几度华繁。 常常在，金壶碧酒，高会列仙班。 其三　李社长寿 桃蕴蒸红，杏开微白，仲春风物宜人。 莫疏九叶，陇右降天真。 应瑞葱葱佳气，宝睨灶、劫外浓熏。 呜金玉，琅琅声裹，高会洞中宾。 良辰当劝勉，仙风道骨，早早离尘。 悟人问虚幻，着莫因循。 看取蟠桃结子，灵芝秀、不羡庄桩。 常如此，洞天深处，独步骯长春。 玉蝴蝶 扰扰梦中身世，白驹过隙，多少时光。 使尽机关方寸，不暂清冻。 蓄奸邪、更移鹿马，执迷网、颠倒玄黄一最堪伤。 死生汨没，苦海茫茫。 难忘。 恩绳爱索，火坑尘网，利锁名缰。 一向贪饕，不知青鬓染秋霜。 覆焦隍、空争骇鹿，多岐路、馒逐亡羊。 自徊徨。 白云深处，一灶心香。 其二　村居 炯外地偏尘远，结茅小隐，事事俱休。 脱粟黄薹安分，足可优游。 月徘徊、昂簪缓步，风玲淡、悬涕慵收。 且淹留。 野云归岫，烟水横秋。 唯收。 随身数物，静巾悦手，细栉梳头。 钵置囊闲，杖华百袖外无求。 唱哩啰、招来牧坚，相伞汝、取次沙鸥。 更何忧。 奏刀无碍，不见全牛。 金童捧露盘 梦幻阎浮，舍故趋新，倏忽化机潜换。 天地一丘墟，会心冥冲漠，野云舒卷。 寄迩虚舟，鉴形止水，风激游丝断。 空玉宇无尘清澈，混物我冤亲，相忘鹏钨。 镇榕散。 此际谷食鹑居，逍遥游宴‘。 闻乎无声，视无色，罢金锟去膜，作空花观。 窗户有余清，泯人牛踪迹，素华明焕。 胜盘幽遐，洞灵缥渺，直许草真骯。 步坦途，摇头村臂，到醉乡，胜入高阳池馆。 世情远。 浮生瞬息归来晚。 其二　同前 高会云朋，谈笑人问，几度海涛清浅。 天地一吹嘘，动阎浮出没，化机如电。 覆手存亡，转头聚散，物物虚零乱。 馒戏弄蜗蛮槐蚁，向魂梦悠悠，雄图坚远。 无尽藏，山舟密运，丘陵移换。 团空人世，竟无识，柢形囚浩劫，浪传余喘。 种性却回邪，向铜盘声裹，太阳难辨。 试运金媲，拨开朦膜，眸子寻常见。 待细察蝶螟若山，贯法界灵空，慈云弥满。 了真观。 方知下手须臾晚。 玉女摇仙佩 先天有物，未始难名，彷佛氤氲元气。 太极形生，鸡黄乍判，散作万殊千异。 总被形囚累。 恣营营念虑，多方百计。 竞声利，扬波鼓浪，唯是无穷，四事而已。 空胶扰人问，贩骨番腾，终成何济。 谁信火传弃旧，物禅迎新，弄我真同儿戏。 勘破摇头，伸眉一笑，照彻多生凝滞。 妄构闲非是。 总休论枉玷，林泉风味。 秋静夜，云收空界，纤尘不动，月明如水。 人长在，碧桃影裹醺醺醉。 东风第一枝 远樊笼、虚舟不系，披览闲中真趣。 未尝羡、坷里荣名，未尝羡、金闺矩步。 乾坤俯仰，开肩牖、晃朗庭衢，会襟期、径入无何，脱巾奋然箕踞。
chunks.translated_text:
**For the Perfect Realization (Continued)**

The whole is never lacking,
true origin never false—
how could there ever be more or less?
The numinous source spans antiquity,
of the same class as heaven and earth.
Yet pure, it is stained by the ten thousand conditions,
giving rise to feelings and perceptions,
summoning demons and guilt.
Hard to transcend—
living in vain, dying in vain,
cast adrift in the sea of suffering.

With wisdom, one seeks liberation,
but a single thought’s return to the pivot
decides enlightenment in the realm of nothingness.
Examine the original, ever-present,
the slightest deviation a distortion.
All manifestations, all phenomena—
clearly, they remain
the same old mountains and rivers.
Hold high the mirror,
then shatter it again,
clapping hands and laughing aloud.

---

**Second: Celebrating Master Li’s Eightieth Year**

The Southern Pole stores auspiciousness,
the Lesser Hidden Star manifests its sign—
at eighty, he appears in the human realm.
Water and clouds drift freely,
golden crucible refines the elixir of spirit.
Having swept clean the Grotto of Eternal Spring,
he roams carefree beyond the world’s dust,
occupying lofty leisure.
No aging—
tortoises circle, cranes encircle,
face to face, they share joy.

Deeply moved, we offer repeated prayers,
tending the warm furnace, shouldering the stove,
hoisting the sandalwood banner beyond kalpas.
Recall his primordial countenance—
not a trace of withering.
Through ancient and modern, swift as dawn and dusk,
how many times has he witnessed
the peach’s flourishing bloom?
Ever present,
golden pot of jade wine,
high feast among the ranks of immortals.

---

**Third: For Elder Li’s Longevity**

Peaches blush crimson,
apricots open pale white—
mid-spring’s scenery delights.
Do not neglect the nine-leaf lineage,
from Longyou descends the celestial perfected.
Auspicious vapors rise thickly,
treasure crucible’s incense wafts beyond kalpas.
Jade chimes resound,
their clear tones enfolding
the honored guests of the grotto’s high assembly.

This fine occasion calls for exhortation:
with immortal’s bearing and Daoist bones,
leave the dust early.
Awaken to the illusory world—
do not cling to old ways.
Behold the peach setting fruit,
the magic fungus flourishing,
envying not the sturdiest tree.
Ever thus,
deep in the grotto-heaven,
stride alone through eternal spring.

---

**Jade Butterfly**

Restless, this dreamlike existence,
a white colt flashing past the gap—
how much time remains?
Exhausting schemes and stratagems,
never a moment’s clarity.
Hoarding treachery, shifting deer for horses,
entangled in nets, inverting black and yellow—
most pitiable.
Life and death rush on,
the bitter sea boundless.

Unforgettable—
the ropes of kindness, the snares of love,
fire pits, dust nets,
shackles of profit, reins of fame.
Ever gluttonous,
unaware of temples frosting white.
Chasing mirages in scorched moats,
racing down branching paths after lost sheep.
Wandering alone—
deep in white clouds,
a single stick of heart’s incense.

---

**Second: Rustic Dwelling**

Beyond the bustle, the land remote from dust,
thatched hut shelters a minor hermit—
all affairs come to rest.
Coarse grain and wild greens suffice,
ample for leisurely wandering.
Moon lingers,
hairpin raised for a slow stroll;
wind chimes tinkle,
tears idly unshed.
For now, tarry—
wild clouds return to the peaks,
mist and water stretch across autumn.

Only keep
a few things at hand:
a quiet cloth, a joyful brush,
fine comb for the hair.
Bowl in sack, idle;
staff of blossoming cassia—
nothing more to seek.
Singing *li-lo*,
beckon the shepherd boy;
with you, the carefree gulls.
What more to worry?
Wielding the knife without hindrance,
no longer seeing the whole ox.

---

**Golden Youth Bearing the Dew Tray**

Dreamlike, the world of Jambudvīpa,
abandoning the old, chasing the new—
in an instant, the mechanism of change shifts.
Heaven and earth, a single mound of ruins,
the heart’s understanding merges with vast emptiness,
wild clouds unfurl and roll.
Entrusting to the near, the empty boat,
mirroring form in still water,
wind severs drifting threads.
The jade firmament, dustless, limpid—
blending foe and kin,
forgetting the roc and the wren.

Ever steadfast, scattered—
in this moment, grain like a quail’s, dwelling like a nest,
roaming and feasting carefree.
Hearing without sound,
seeing without color,
discarding the golden blade, shedding the film—
regarding as empty flowers.
Windows and doors retain their clarity,
erasing the traces of ox and man,
pristine radiance shines.
Beyond the mundane,
in the grotto’s mystery, ethereal and distant,
directly permitted to join the true and the pure.
Walk the level path,
shaking head, waving sleeves,
arriving drunk in the land of intoxication—
better than entering the Pavilion of High Yang.
Worldly concerns far—
floating life, in an instant, returns late.

---

**Second: Same Theme**

High assembly of cloud companions,
laughing and conversing in the world—
how many times have the sea’s waves calmed?
Heaven and earth, a single breath,
moving Jambudvīpa’s rise and fall,
the mechanism of change swift as lightning.
With a flip of the hand, existence and extinction;
with a turn of the head, gathering and scattering—
all things vain and disordered.
Playing with ants on the locust tree,
dreaming of ambitions vast and firm.
The inexhaustible treasury—
mountains as boats, secretly shifting,
hills and mounds transposed.

This human world, a ball of emptiness,
yet none recognize
the mere form imprisoned in the great kalpa,
waves of breath barely lingering.
Nature turns back from error—
within the bronze plate’s sound,
even the sun is hard to discern.
Test the golden mirror,
brush aside the misty film—
the pupil sees as usual.
Awaiting closer inspection of butterflies and moths like mountains,
pervading the dharma-realm’s numinous emptiness,
compassionate clouds suffuse all.
Only then, the true vision—
realizing the moment of action comes late.

---

**Jade Maiden Shaking the Immortal’s Girdle**

Before heaven, there was something,
never easily named—
vaguely, the primal qi’s swirling mist.
The Great Ultimate’s form emerged,
the golden chicken’s first division,
scattering into ten thousand differences.
All ensnared by form’s bondage,
indulging in restless thoughts,
schemes in a hundred directions.
Competing for fame and profit,
stirring waves, raising tides—
all for nothing, merely the four affairs.

Vainly entangled in the world,
trading bones, flipping fortunes—
what end does it serve?
Who believes the fire passed on, the old discarded,
things transformed, the new welcomed—
playing with my truth like a child’s game?
Seeing through it, shake your head,
raise your brows and laugh,
illuminating lifetimes of stagnation.
False constructions, idle rights and wrongs—
all worthless, like the wind’s flavor in the forest.
Autumn’s quiet night,
clouds gather, the sky’s expanse clear,
not a speck of dust stirs,
moon bright as water.
Ever abiding,
drunk in the shadow of the jade peach.

---

**First Branch of the East Wind**

Far from the cage, the empty boat untethered,
unfolding the true delight of leisure.
Never envying
the honor of the muddy ditch,
never envying
the measured steps of the golden chamber.
Heaven and earth, surveyed in a glance,
shoulders and windows thrown open,
the courtyard’s thoroughfare bright and clear.
Gathering robes, entering directly into nothingness,
doffing the cap, sitting boldly with legs spread.

Neither do I envy
the coiled dragon’s ascent or phoenix’s flight,
nor do I inquire
of libraries of letters or arsenals of arms.
To act—what act, what non-action?
To ponder—what thought, what non-thought?
Serene and plain,
moving through the world,
settled in ease,
turning to my old garden,
commanding the radiant breeze—
returning, I seem to regret the lateness of dusk.

**Second Branch: In Praise of Tea**

The sealed wrapper splits,
the dragon cake is broken open,
the mechanism of the tea tree foreseen.
Jade lads prepare it,
fragrant mist lightly rising,
silver kettles draw forth
the sacred spring’s fresh offering.
A master’s touch—
bristling beard, striking
the whale-wave to foam.
By this gentleman’s
modest skill,
jade blossoms finely float
upon the bowl’s surface.

This passage
lifts the entire koan—
fit for savoring,
no need for flattery or urging.
It scours the dust from the heart,
stilling all residue,
unlocking the moon of the mind,
a single slice of pure cold.
Grass demons, swept away like lightning,
within and without gleaming,
the original truth alone revealed.
Meeting Lu Tong,
hand in hand in Penglai,
lingering in the crystal palace.

chunks.original_text: 玉童报朝彻。 仙梦断、华胥太平国。 素屏侧、金炉暖、灰衬云心虚白。 御封坼，一瓣才拈清馥馥，氤氲满、灵空无问隔。 遍飘三境融融，通高厚，贯金石。 神州初凝玉釜，记不萌枝上，微露春色。 几人识，尘凡阻、岂许垂瓜明得。 气绵密、洞府高真俱默会，游蜂蝶、纷纷无处觅，杳然曳缕虚凝，入寥天一。 其二 莲塘雨初歇。 波面倚、琼花照澄澈。 命童折，银鉼浸、姑射仙姿凝洁。 默时说，大地寥天俱捻聚，无巨细、收来藏贝叶。 放开微药真光，尘沙界，尽朝彻。 一枝冥传亘古，向无声色裹，出广长舌。 莫分别，纤毫受、入眼还同金屑。 拂陈迩、物物般般无尽藏，闲桃李、真容俱漏泄。 再拈谁肯承当，付花梢月。 齐天乐 自为形所累，寒饿交侵，赘疣何异。 试究虚玄从初本，有一点圆明无际。 尘绿漠漠，似千里晴空，幻生云翳。 仗此灵风，一时吹扫莫留滞。 来之偷然，往焉适耳，从伊粒点，鼠肝虫臂。 变化洪炉，存亡皆可，除外甚么堪畏。 逢魔遇阻，驾神马尸输，去留谁计。 稳坐忘怀，始终凭此志。 春从天上来 幂幂尘埃。 叹自古悠悠，不省沉埋。 利名场上，人我丛中，单认这个形骸。 念本来一点，谁无分、都是仙材。 馒疑猜。 唤千声酩酊，不肯头回。 何日梦中惊觉，管识破从前，白蚁庭槐。 洞天深处，霞友云朋，谈冰咀雪相陪。 对紫芝幽圃，香风裹、碧酒倾杯。 信悠哉。 有龙蟠虎绕，沉醉蓬莱。 其二天　寿节 帝锡嘉祥。 正九五龙飞，大业繁昌。 斡旋洪造，整顿乾坤，雷轰电掣成章。 向玉京金阙，威音震、胆裂遐荒。 胜陶唐。 应草真交会，四海平康。 宁论普天率土，但蠢尔生民，共赖胥匡。 峭翘端蚊，葵蕾倾心，曷报惠泽恩光。 灶兰熏瑞霭，祈黄屋、枝叶联芳。 祝吾皇。 愿龙图永固，圣寿无疆。 其三 身世蜗蛮。 在一气盈虚，宛转循环。 电光影裹，石火星中，生灭如许时问。 尽劳神胶扰，名与利、抵死相干。 自摧残。 为一团虚幻，百种机关。 睫在眼前不见，但认假为真，倒大痴顽。 太平难遇，真道难逢，识取旧日家山。 到无何乡裹，云霞步、玉药芝兰。 会仙班。 庆长春天上，来满人寰。 其四 肥马轻衫。 富贵裹功名，心醉如酣。 枕中春梦，谁信鹏程，摩天巨翼图南。 被目前虚幻，空樱扰、伽锁擎担。 更何堪。 向蝇头蜗角，苦苦贪婪。 他日眼开方省，便声利场中，税驾停縿。 着鞭方外，打破疑团，玲笑暮四朝三。 现本来一点，凝然在、秋月寒潭。 个中参。 听金童谣唱，玉女玄谈。 其五 枯木寒灰。 寄野墅茅堂，玲淡林限。 地偏人静，月朗风清，窗户绝点尘埃。 有自然消息，银霞璨、珠玉琼瑰。 信悠哉。 看龙蟠金鼎，凤舞丹台。 举世利名心醉，更谁仗鹏程，密网冲开。 此言还信，惆傥男儿，休更撒手空回。 认空生虚幻，何成济、枉玷仙材。 早归来。 赴蟠桃高会，谈笑蓬莱。 雨中花 一点灵源，澄湛照彻，多生浩劫情尘。 有不夜壶天风物，亘古仍存。 踞闯玉麟哮吼，对床石女谈论。 海童微念，寥天晴雪，不下鸥旱。 峭翘蠢蠕，同入吹嘘。 寒谷为我回春。 那更有、越昤思旧，楚些招魂。 尽想铜盘蜡炬，摩罕晚照余熏。 神丹既济，玄珠好在，默默昏昏。 其二 林下山间，人市处处，天游在在玄虚。 更不许丝毫增损，具足无余。
chunks.translated_text:
The Jade Lad reports the dawn’s end.
The immortal dream breaks—
from the land of Hua Xu’s great peace.
By the plain screen, the golden censer warms,
ash cradling the cloud-heart’s hollow whiteness.
The imperial seal splits—
a single petal lifted, pure fragrance brims,
steeping all in mist, the numinous void unbarred.
It drifts through the Three Realms in harmony,
piercing height and depth, penetrating metal and stone.
The divine land first congeals in the jade cauldron,
recalling how on the unbudded branch,
a trace of spring’s hue once glimmered.
How many know—
the dust-bound world obstructs,
denying even the gourd’s clear sight?
Qi dense and unbroken,
the high immortals of cavern-palaces all silently meet.
Butterflies and bees swarm in vain,
nowhere to alight—
ethereal, trailing threads congeal in emptiness,
entering the vast sky as one.

---

**Second Stanza: After the Lotus Pond’s Rain Ceases**
On the wave’s surface leans
jade blossoms mirrored in limpid clarity.
The lad is bidden to pluck them,
silver scoops to steep—
the fairy of Mount Gu She, frozen in purity.
In silence it speaks:
the vast earth and boundless sky all gathered in a pinch,
no great nor small,
drawn in to be stored in the *pattra* leaf.
Unfurled, the true light of subtle medicine,
the dust-sand realm
fully awakens at dawn.
A single stem, darkly transmitted since antiquity,
emerges from the realm of sound and form,
extending its vast and boundless tongue.
Do not discriminate—
the finest particle received,
entering the eye as golden flakes.
Brushing away the near and far,
each and every thing holds boundless treasuries.
Idle peach and plum trees
leak their true countenances.
Who now dares to take up the task,
entrusting it to the moon on the flower’s tip?

---

**Joy of the Level Sky**
Self-enslaved by form,
cold and hunger assail,
no different from superfluous growths.
Probe the empty and profound from the primal origin—
there is a single point, round and bright, boundless.
Dust-green stretches vast,
like a thousand miles of clear sky,
illusion spawns cloudy veils.
Rely on this numinous wind,
blowing all away in an instant, leaving no trace.
Coming—suddenly,
going—wherever,
following that speck,
be it mouse liver or insect limb.
The great furnace of transformation,
existence and extinction alike—
what beyond this is to be feared?
Meeting demons or obstacles,
riding the divine steed or corpse-cart,
who reckons departure or stay?
Sit steadfast, forgetful of care,
from beginning to end, rely on this resolve.

---

**Spring Comes from Heaven Above**
Layer upon layer of dust.
Alas, since ancient times, endlessly,
none awaken from their burial.
In the arena of profit and fame,
amid the throng of self and others,
they recognize only this bodily form.
Recall the original single point—
who lacks a share?
All are immortal material.
Yet they hesitate, suspect.
Call them a thousand times, drunk,
they refuse to turn their heads.
When will they startle awake in dreams,
seeing through all that came before,
the white ants’ court and locust tree?
In the depths of the grotto-heaven,
with rosy-cloud friends and mist companions,
they converse, tasting ice and snow.
Facing the purple mushrooms of the secluded garden,
fragrant winds enfold,
green wine pours into cups.
Truly carefree!
With dragons coiling and tigers circling,
they sink into drunkenness in Penglai.

---

**Second Stanza: The Emperor’s Birthday**
Heaven bestows auspicious omens.
Now the Nine-Five Dragon soars,
the great enterprise flourishes.
Turning the vast creation,
setting the cosmos in order,
thunder roars and lightning flashes to compose the pattern.
Toward the jade capital and golden towers,
the mighty sound shakes—
gall bladders of distant lands burst in fear.
Surpassing the age of Yao and Tang.
Surely the true conjunction arrives,
the four seas at peace and prosperous.
Why speak of all under heaven?
Even the lowliest creatures,
all rely on his aid and rectification.
Upright as the *qiao* orchid,
sunflowers turn their hearts,
how to repay the grace of his beneficent radiance?
The stove’s orchid perfumes the auspicious mist,
praying for the yellow palace,
branches and leaves united in fragrance.
We pray for our emperor:
may the dragon’s chart stand firm forever,
his sacred longevity boundless.

---

**Third Stanza: The Snail-Shell World of Existence**
In the ebb and flow of a single qi,
winding and cycling.
Within the lightning’s shadow,
amid the spark of flint,
birth and extinction in such fleeting moments.
All exhaust themselves in restless striving,
name and profit
clashing to the death.
Self-destructing—
for a mass of illusion,
a hundred kinds of schemes.
The eyelash before the eye unseen,
mistaking the false for true,
utterly deluded and stubborn.
Peace is hard to encounter,
the true Dao hard to meet—
recognize the old homeland of days past.
Arriving in the land of nothingness,
treading clouds and mist,
gathering jade medicines and magic mushrooms.
Joining the immortal ranks,
celebrating long spring in heaven above,
descending to fill the mortal realm.

---

**Fourth Stanza: Fat Horses and Light Robes**
Wealth and honor enfold merit and fame,
the heart drunk as if intoxicated.
The spring dream of the pillow—
who believes in the roc’s journey,
the vast wings soaring southward?
Ensnared by the illusions of the present,
vainly entangled,
bearing the yoke and carrying the burden.
What more can be endured?
Chasing the fly’s head and snail’s horn,
bitterly, greedily craving.
One day, eyes open at last,
in the arena of fame and profit,
they halt their chariots and rest their steeds.
Beyond the whip’s reach,
shattering the web of doubt,
laughing at the evening’s four and morning’s three.
The original single point appears,
serene within—
the autumn moon on the cold pool.
Within this, they contemplate.
Listen to the golden lads’ ballads,
the jade maidens’ profound discourse.

---

**Fifth Stanza: Withered Wood and Cold Ash**
Dwelling in a rustic cottage,
a thatched hall in the wilds,
secluded among pines and forests.
The land remote, the people quiet,
moon bright, wind clear,
windows and doors free of dust’s touch.
There is a natural message,
silver radiance gleaming,
pearls and jade, coral and gems.
Truly carefree!
Behold the dragon coiling in the golden tripod,
the phoenix dancing on the cinnabar terrace.
The whole world drunk on fame and profit—
who else, relying on the roc’s journey,
breaks through the dense net?
If these words are believed,
stalwart men,
do not let go and return empty-handed.
Recognizing emptiness as illusion,
how can it be accomplished?
In vain, they tarnish immortal material.
Return early!
Attend the grand gathering of the peach banquet,
laughing and conversing in Penglai.

---

**Rain-Scattered Flowers**
A single numinous source,
lucid and penetrating,
the dust of passions from kalpas past.
There is an unending celestial realm of wind and things,
existing since time immemorial.
The jade qilin squats and roars,
the stone maiden faces the bed, discoursing.
The sea lad’s faint念,
the vast sky’s clear snow,
does not descend like gulls in drought.
Upright as the *qiao* orchid, wriggling as insects,
all drawn into the breath.
The cold valley revives spring for me.
Moreover, there is—
the Yue’s *ling* thinking of the past,
the Chu’s *sa* summoning souls.
All imagine the bronze tray and wax torches,
the late glow of the *mohan*’s lingering fragrance.
The divine elixir already perfected,
the dark pearl intact,
silent and dim.

---

**Second Stanza: Amid Forests and Mountains, In Marketplaces Everywhere**
Heavenly wandering in every place of mystery and void.
Never permitted the slightest addition or subtraction,
fully endowed, nothing lacking.

chunks.original_text: 漆桶甘沉杂间，戏场自作涂糊。 枯骸隐几，苍天谁问，枉用吹嘘。 形名寓耳，观缕真容，非铅非汞非珠。 纵举似、百端拈弄，妙处难模。 谁有轮扁手段，成风去垩功夫。 头头物物，洪纤巨细，色色如如。 其三＃１ 二十年问，曾记对语，山阳森碧琅圩。 谈笑裹蓬莱清浅，陆涨波澜。 惊喜灵根无恙，双明玉树同看。 搀抢境裹，漫漫长夜，共话团乐。 余生散漫，江海虚舟，一叶不揆循环。 俱老矣、关河千里，晤语良难。 自笑姻霞疝疾，半生风月长闲。 别时好在，云根水骨，相对怡颜。 望海潮 春冰初伴，长川汹涌，桃花碧涨波澜。 海若幸临，冯夷自笑，灵源退鹊来还。 涂抹兴阑珊。 便截断悬流，拨转机关。 回首人问底事，胶扰蚁循环。 莲莲世梦惊残。 顾云问岫幌，月贲山颜。 芳草藉茵，森松偃盖，峰峦耸碧栏杆。 天地许多宽。 方自在无拘，心契金兰。 寄语功成事遂，佳处莫盟寒。 洞仙歌 百年光影，绿鬓须臾改。 扰扰劳生是非海。 料存亡、隐显盈虚兴废事，尽默听、玄中真宰。 甚狗苟蝇营，为浮名薄利苦萦心，万般机械。 闲中一着，莫妄生枝派。 平地瀛洲故人在。 运灵风扫荡情尘，须勘破、生死牢关悬解。 便领略玄珠用无穷，得自在逍遥，去来无碍。 其二 千魔万难，苦海沉沦惯。 柳锁浑身强牵挽。 认檐溜、一点浮枢来又去，识不破、空华虚幻。 便酩酊朝昏，又谁知在本有真灵，万尘羁绊。 梦回酒醒，子细开青眼。 闲裹光阴着心看。 髑髅元不会束西，还戏弄、千古轮回无限。 但省后收心便归来，莫只待西山，日沉天晚。 月中仙 浩浩灵源，自先天恍惚，难貌形状。 殊非想像，罢兔角龟毛，头头分朗。 百般呈仗俩，尽分外、无风起浪。 截断亡羊路，山云野水，相与复相忘。 神光照应无方。 示灰寒地文，舒缓天壤。 低头放杖。 便击木无声，敲空作响。 不须求罔象。 得自在、无拘纵放。 信手拈来，用如意宝珠无尽藏。 粉蝶儿 嚼蜡尘情，谁知淡然无味。 贩何楼、一场儿戏。 看成空，浑不懂，梦中身世。 馒横陈，使机关、到头何济。 省后俱休，寻个久长之计。 便收心、破除人伪。 远樊笼，捐俗物，洞天嘉致。 结云庵，对西山、万峰凝翠。 其二 薄利浮名，抵死向前忙干。 更光阴、暗中催断。 傀儡棚，详抢弄，般成公案。 下场时，尽卢都、不堪重看。 风递晨钟，惊觉梦中青眼。 觉从前、尽成虚幻。 火坑中，安稳地，自由人拣。 早归来，莫祇待、日沉天晚。 其三
chunks.translated_text:
The lacquer bucket sinks sweetly amidst the杂,
the playhouse makes its own muddle.
Dry bones lean on the armrest,
who questions the azure sky?
Vainly they deploy their breath.
Forms and names lodge in the ear,
observing the thread of the true visage—
neither lead nor mercury nor pearl.
Though raised in a hundred guises,
the wondrous place remains unpatterned.

Who possesses the skill of Wheelwright Bian,
the craft of wind and the art of whitewash?
Every thing in every aspect,
vast or fine, great or small,
each and all thusness.
Its Third #1

Twenty years of inquiry—
do you recall our dialogue
amid the emerald groves of Shanyang?
Laughter wrapped in Penglai’s shallows,
where land swelled into waves.
Startled joy at the unharmed divine root,
the twin luminous jade trees beheld together.
Jostling within the realm,
through the boundless long night,
we spoke of shared delight.
My remaining years drift,
a hollow boat on rivers and seas,
a single leaf untethered to cycles.
All grown old now—
a thousand li of passes and rivers,
meeting to converse is rare indeed.

I laugh at my rosy mists and colic,
half a lifetime spent in wind and moon’s long leisure.
At parting, may the cloud-root and water-bone
face each other with gladdened countenance.

*Wang Hai Chao*
Spring ice first companions,
the long river surges,
peach blossoms green the swelling waves.
If the Sea Lord deigns to come,
Feng Yi smiles to himself,
the numinous spring retreats as magpies return.
Painting’s interest wanes.
Then sever the hanging torrent,
turn the mechanism’s wheel.
Looking back at worldly affairs—
what binds and distracts like ants in cycles?

The lotus-world’s dream shatters.
Gazing at cloud-veiled peaks,
moon embellishes the mountain’s face.
Fragrant grasses spread their mat,
towering pines bow like canopies,
peaks rise beside the jade balustrade.
Heaven and earth so vast—
just then, unbound and at ease,
hearts in golden covenant.
A message to those who’ve achieved their work:
in the finest place, do not grow cold.

*Dong Xian Ge*
A hundred years of light and shadow,
green temples fade in an instant.
The bustling, toiling life—
a sea of right and wrong.
Consider all matters of existence and extinction,
concealment and revelation, fullness and emptiness, rise and fall—
all silently heed the true arbiter within the mystery.

Why, like dogs and flies,
torment yourself for fleeting fame and meager profit,
entangled in ten thousand schemes?
In leisure, take one step—
do not recklessly branch out.
On the level ground of Penglai, old friends remain.
Let the spirit wind sweep away the dust of passion,
you must break through the suspended barrier of life and death.
Then grasp the boundless use of the dark pearl,
attaining carefree wandering,
coming and going without hindrance.

Its Second
A thousand demons, ten thousand hardships,
accustomed to sinking in the bitter sea.
Willow chains drag the whole body,
forcing and hauling.
Recognizing the eaves’ drip—
a single floating pivot comes and goes,
yet you fail to see through the empty flower’s illusion.
Drunk from dawn to dusk,
who knows the true spirit inherent in the original?
Ten thousand dusts entangle.
Awakening from the dream, sober from wine,
open your blue eyes and look closely.
In leisure, observe time with the heart.
The skull fundamentally knows no east or west,
still playing with endless kalpas of rebirth.
But awaken later and return the mind—
do not wait until the western mountain,
when the sun sinks and the sky darkens.

*Yue Zhong Xian*
The vast numinous spring,
from the prior heaven’s indistinctness,
defies depiction.
Far from imagination,
no rabbit horns or turtle hairs—
each and all distinctly bright.
A hundred guises presented,
all extraneous, waves rising without wind.
Sever the path of the lost sheep,
mountain clouds and wild waters,
mutually forgetting one another.

The divine light shines without direction,
revealing ash-cold earth patterns,
stretching across heaven and earth.
Lower your head, set down your staff—
strike wood, no sound;
knock on emptiness, it resounds.
No need to seek the formless.
Attain freedom,
unrestrained and unbound.
Trusting the hand to pluck it,
use the wish-fulfilling pearl’s inexhaustible treasury.

*Fen Die Er*
Chewing waxen dusts of passion,
who knows their bland tastelessness?
What tower’s farce—
a play of emptiness.
Utterly uncomprehending,
a dream’s life and world.
Helplessly sprawled,
deploying mechanisms—
what use in the end?
Awaken later, let all rest,
seek a lasting plan.
Then gather the mind,
break through human falsity.
Far from the cage,
cast off worldly things,
embrace the cave-heaven’s fine essence.
Knit a cloud hermitage,
facing the western mountains,
where ten thousand peaks congeal in emerald.

Its Second
Meager profit and fleeting fame,
desperately striving forward.
Time, too, silently urges on.
The puppet stage,
jostling and performing,
becomes a public case.
When the play ends,
all is but ashes—
unworthy of a second look.
The wind carries the morning bell,
startling awake the dream’s blue eyes.
Awareness reveals all before
as mere illusion.
In the fire pit,
a stable place—
freedom’s people choose.
Return early,
do not wait until
the sun sinks and the sky darkens.

Its Third

chunks.original_text: 绿鬓朱颜，那禁两输乌兔。 被恩柳、爱绳缠住。 重如山，深似海，浑身担负。 转头看，只赢得、一丘闲土。 些子时光，白乾自招忧苦。 早抽身、快寻出路。 水云乡，闲笑傲，开怀行步。 有玄珠，待归来、向伊分付。 婆罗门引 一毫不立，万缘俱遣露真诠。 虚蹑景泠然。 莫向他方物外，别觅洞中天。 是韩胪逐块，阳焰为泉。 亘初本源。 只这是、更无玄。 默究端端的的，体用完全。 分分朗朗，放一段光明不记年。 还会得、心月团圆。 其二 古今扰扰，大都奔竞利名场。
chunks.translated_text:
Green temples and crimson cheeks—
how endure the twin losses of crow and hare?
Snared by the silken cords of favor,
bound by the willow’s tender grasp.
Burden piled mountain-high,
depths like the sea,
the whole body weighed down.
Turn the head to look—
only a mound of idle earth won.

This fleeting span of time,
white-haired, self-invited sorrow.
Withdraw early,
quickly seek the way out.
To the land of water and clouds,
idly roam and laugh,
walk with open heart.
A dark pearl awaits—
upon return, entrust it to them.

**Brahmin’s Prelude**
Not a single thread stands,
all conditions cast away—
the true meaning revealed.
Lightly tread the scene,
serene and clear.
Seek not beyond this realm,
nor in other worlds,
the cave-heaven apart.
Like Han Lu chasing clods,
or mistaking mirage for spring—
the primal source endures.
This alone—
nothing more profound.
Silently investigate,
precise and true,
essence and function complete.
Bright and boundless,
a radiance unmarked by years.
When you grasp it,
the moon of the heart rounds full.

**Its Second**
From ancient times to now,
the clamor never ceases—
all rush to the arena
of profit and fame.

desperately striving forward.
Time, too, silently urges on.
The puppet stage,
jostling and performing,
becomes a public case.
When the play ends,
all is but ashes—
unworthy of a second look.
The wind carries the morning bell,

Awareness reveals all before
as mere illusion.
In the fire pit,
a stable place—
freedom’s people choose.
Return early,
do not wait until
the sun sinks and the sky darkens.

chunks.original_text: 舟车仆马如狂。 到底功勋事业，分付梦黄粱。 甚刚求失鹿，不见亡羊。 且宜自防。 须着脚、水云乡。 截断从来去路，步步清冻。 本然自得，是千古圆明珠玉房。 真个事、谁肯承当。 其三 洞天物外，自然真境妙难传。 掌真宴赏留连。 鹤舞龙昤凤啸，飞雾走云烟。 拥霓旌月节，羽盖芝饼。 醉中论玄。 喷珠玉，诉流泉。 笑指蓬莱清浅，几度变桑田。 真容亘古，纵劫火焚空无变迁。 谁解此、紫府神仙。 其四 此身有限，利名无尽苦贪求。 人问事事何楼。 大抵百年光景，赢得一荒丘。 似花梢晨露，水面浮呕。 省时便休。 须勘破、此形囚。 千古迷绳割断，跳出洪流。 逍遥坦荡，炼一粒神丹物外游。 功行满、平步瀛洲。 侍香金童 天壤之问，荡荡无拘束。 一二襟期资野服。 何处会心宜卜筑。 万壑松风，一溪寒玉。 炯茅堂、澹灶温炉香味馥。
chunks.translated_text:
Boats and carriages, servants and steeds—mad as frenzy.
In the end, merit and enterprise,
entrusted to the yellow millet dream.
Why stubbornly chase the lost deer,
blind to the straying sheep?
Best guard yourself well.
Step firmly toward
the land of water and clouds.
Sever the old paths of coming and going,
each step pure and clear.
Naturally self-attained,
this is the eternal chamber of luminous pearl and jade.
Truly so—
who would dare claim it?

**Its Third**
Beyond the world, within cave-heavens,
a realm of natural truth, wondrous and hard to convey.
Palms hold true feasts, lingering in delight.
Cranes dance, dragons chant, phoenixes cry,
mists fly, clouds drift.
Rainbow banners and moon-tipped staves,
feathered canopies and mushroom cakes.
Drunkenly discourse on the profound,
spitting pearls and jade,
murmuring like flowing springs.
Laughing, point to Penglai’s shallows—
how many times has it turned to mulberry fields?
The true visage endures through ages,
even if kalpa-fire burns all to ash, it remains unchanged.
Who understands this—
the immortals of the Purple Court?

**Its Fourth**
This body is finite,
yet fame and gain are endless, bitterly sought.
People ask: for what towering deeds?
In the end, a hundred years of light
win only a desolate mound.
Like morning dew on flower tips,
or foam upon the water’s face.
Wake in time—let go.
See through this bodily prison.
Cut the thousand-year snare of delusion,
leap from the torrent’s flood.
Carefree and unbound,
refine a single grain of divine elixir,
roam beyond the world.
When merit and practice are full,
step lightly onto Penglai’s isles.

**Attendant Incense-Bearing Youth**
Between heaven and earth,
vast and unbounded.
A simple robe suffices for a few kindred spirits.
Where to find a place for the heart to dwell?
Among ten thousand valleys of pine winds,
a single stream of cold jade.
A thatched hall gleams,
a plain stove warms the incense burner—fragrance rich.

chunks.original_text: 听雅奏、云和尘外曲。 列岫窗分真面月。 未到蓬瀛，乃平生足。 传言玉女 腼面相逢，一顾眼中人识。 会心冥处，遥山寸碧。 洞天云影，磊落翠岔蟠石。 芝英好在，几经秋色。 浅浅蓬瀛，谈笑问、沧海易。 采真携手，共游天地一。 人问尽想，电转风翻尘物。 玉峰高会，莫通消息。 望梅花 布袍 厅布宽袍制就。 开掩快、不须纲纽。 虚豁襟怀，笼通腋下，舒缩恣容双肘。 别无有。 外盖行披，更兼宜、众中袖手。 似惫全身领受。 又何妨、顾前盼后。 雅称芒鞋，偏宜华杖，出入送迎霞友。 有开口。 问斤两何如，便分明、向伊抖擞。 其二　纳袄 不用衣衫楚楚。 随绿化、布帛丝缕。 选甚青黄，从交横顺，下手裹头联补。 见功处。 百片千条，紧穿连、着身坚固。 如意御寒冒暑。 随所在、别无疑虑。 转肘爬搔，浑身辊园，一任不须回护。 没人观。 □ 自在纵横，敢承当、个中作主。 蓦山溪 平生懒散，不识闲烦恼。 蜗舍但容身，更谁问、瑶台琼岛。 比邻纵有，三两野人家，忘取舍，绝将迎，门外何曾到。 烟霞症疾，妙药难除疗。 只管放心闲，未肯把、灵源胶扰。 住行坐外，此外别无能，真个事，乐逍遥，便是前程了。 其二 眨眉瞬目，说尽重玄理。 黄叶止啼休，莫只待、锋锋相抵。 玉关人老，归去罢论兵，闲日月，太平年，村酿家家是。 横担拄杖，唱个哩啰哩。 岂羡庙堂荣，更管甚、泥中曳尾。 锦鳞自在，腾跃禹门高，收网罟，撒丝纶，不用垂钩饵。 其三 从来习性，尘冗知多少。 省后急消磨，动静裹、专专计较。 闲非闲是，不挂一丝头，牢闭口，紧降心，人我先除扫。 住行坐外，莫把心王恼。 向上有机关，更不许、愚迷便晓。 积功累行，慧眼忽然开，芝草秀，大丹成，作个仙无老。 其四 蹉跎十载，养就真无赖。 事事不萦心，更绝尽、凡情世态。 将迎玲淡，度日且闲闲，翻着袜，到穿衣，一任人憎爱。 铸就三尺，口□ 龙泉快。 气焰彻天庭，又不见、全牛可解。 踟跚四顾，不敢等闲看，随身带，密封缄，地久天长在。 鹊桥仙 疑根未断，游魂不返。 多少闲情惹绊。 野云溪水自由身，与利锁、名缰许拣。 尘绿一判，凡情尽遣。 却悔收心已晚。 五云深处醉蟠桃，管不羡、儿孙满眼。 其二 依山隐雾，临池影舞。
chunks.translated_text:
Hear the refined strains,
cloud-borne melodies beyond the dust.
Peaks arrayed at the window part
to reveal the moon’s true face.
Though Penglai’s isles remain unseen,
this life is already full.

So the tale goes—Jade Maidens,
shy-faced, meet by chance,
a single glance recognizing kindred souls.
In the heart’s deep communion,
distant mountains shrink to a thumb’s green.
Cave-heaven’s cloud-shadows,
jumbled verdant crags coiled with rock.
Lingzhi herbs flourish still,
having weathered autumn’s hues.
The shallow Penglai,
laughing, asks:
is the vast sea so easily crossed?
Hand in hand, gather the true,
roam as one through heaven and earth.
People exhaust their thoughts,
like lightning turned, wind-tossed dust motes.
At the jade peaks’ grand gathering,
no word is sent.
Gaze at the plum blossoms—
a wide-sleeved robe, simply cut.
Open or close at will,
no need for clasps or ties.
An untrammled heart,
flowing sleeves, arms free to stretch or bend.
Nothing more.
Worn as a cloak while walking,
doubly suited for folding hands in company.
As if weary, the body fully surrenders,
yet what harm in glancing before or behind?
Elegantly paired with straw sandals,
perfect with a staff of fine wood,
welcoming and sending off cloud companions.
Should one ask its weight,
shake it out before them—clear and bright.

---

**Second Stanza: The Padded Jacket**
No need for finery in dress.
Follow nature’s hues—
cloth and silk, thread by thread.
Choose neither green nor yellow,
let warp and weft fall as they may,
stitching patches where needed.
See the craft:
a hundred pieces, a thousand strips,
tightly sewn, firmly worn.
Adapting to cold and heat,
wherever you go, no doubt lingers.
Arms swing, the body rolls,
all as you please, no need for care.
No one watches.
Freely at ease, boldly take charge,
master of your own domain.

---

**Mountain Brook Tune**
A lifetime of idleness,
knowing no idle vexations.
A snail-shell hut holds the body,
who cares for jade towers or isles of gold?
Though neighbors may dwell nearby—
two or three rustic homes—
I forget taking and leaving,
cut off greeting and farewell,
never stepping beyond the gate.
The malady of mist and clouds,
no wondrous medicine can cure.
Just let the heart rest at ease,
unwilling to disturb the spirit’s source with clamor.
In dwelling, walking, sitting—
beyond these, no other skill.
Truly, this is the matter,
joyful and carefree,
the very path ahead.

---

**Second Stanza**
A blink, a glance,
expounding the profoundest mystery.
The yellow leaf silences the child’s cry—
no need to wait for sharp contention.
The Jade Pass soldier grows old,
go home, cease talk of war.
Leisurely days, peaceful years,
village brew flows in every home.
A staff slung across the shoulder,
singing a carefree tune.
Why envy courtly glory?
What care for trailing one’s tail in the mud?
The golden carp swims free,
leaping high through Yu’s Gate.
Cast aside the nets,
unfurl the lines,
no need for hook or bait.

---

**Third Stanza**
From old, ingrained habits,
how much worldly clutter?
Once awakened, swiftly dissolve them,
in motion or stillness, focus the mind.
Idle rights and idle wrongs,
not a thread of attachment.
Seal the mouth, tightly rein the heart,
first sweep away self and others.
In dwelling, walking, sitting—
do not vex the mind’s king.
Above lies the mechanism,
no longer permitting fools to grasp it at once.
Accumulate merit, pile up practice,
wisdom’s eye suddenly opens.
The magic herb blooms,
the great elixir forms,
becoming an ageless immortal.

---

**Fourth Stanza**
A decade of delay,
nurturing true shamelessness.
Nothing entangles the heart,
utterly severed from worldly passions and ways.
Greeting and parting grow light,
days spent in leisure.
Socks turned inside out,
clothes donned haphazardly,
letting others love or hate as they will.
Forged, the three-foot blade—
the Dragon Spring’s swift edge.
Its radiance pierces the heavens,
yet no whole ox is seen to dissect.
Hesitant, glancing all around,
daring not treat it lightly.
Carried close, sealed tight,
enduring as earth and sky.

---

**Magpie Bridge Immortal**
Doubt’s root not severed,
the wandering soul does not return.
How many idle passions entangle?
Wild clouds, stream waters—
a body free and unbound,
yet still choosing the shackles of profit and fame.
Once the dusty green is judged,
worldly feelings all cast aside,
too late to regret the heart’s late return.
Deep in the five-colored clouds,
drunk on the immortal peach—
no envy for children and grandchildren filling the eyes.

---

**Second Stanza**
Mist-hidden by the mountain,
dancing shadows by the pool.

chunks.original_text: 却被文皮自误。 豫章楠梓有何辜，受斤斧、伤残无数。 惺惺不悟，还同暮故。 身后虚名何处。 霎兄光景认为真，尽忘了、长生道路。 其三 琼分石碎，珠离蚌坏。 文豹丰狐自害。 众中谁肯密藏身，但鼓髻、争头要卖。 夸功即退，成名即败。 镜裹朱颜不再。 到头毕竟化为尘，枉弃却、玄珠宝贝。 其四 玄珠无类，真容无对。 不许纤尘遮盖。 年深团练转分明，要天府、收藏没赛。 全身轻快，浑无机械。 法网尘情俱解。 有人登珑欲商量，此不许、人间贩卖。 其五 天真灵种，华胥入梦。 趣取人问无用。 玄珠天府密封藏，誓不敢、红尘卖弄。 魔军齐哄，声音迎送。 饶取威严尊重。
chunks.translated_text:
Yet ensnared by the trappings of culture—
what crime did the *yuzhang* cedar, the nanmu, commit,
to suffer axe and blade, maimed beyond count?
Clear-eyed yet unenlightened,
still clinging to old dusk.
Where lies the hollow fame left behind?
Mistaking fleeting light for truth,
all thought of the long-life path forgotten.

**Third Stanza**
Jade shattered, stone crushed,
pearls torn from broken oysters.
The striped leopard, the sleek fox—
self-ruin their own fate.
Who among the crowd would hide themselves in secret?
Only to primp and preen, vying to sell their wares.
Boast of merit, then retreat;
claim a name, then fall.
The mirror’s crimson bloom never returns.
In the end, all turns to dust—
vainly discarded, the dark pearl’s treasure.

**Fourth Stanza**
The dark pearl admits no kind,
the true visage has no peer.
Not a speck of dust permitted to veil it.
Years deepen, the tempered steel grows ever clearer,
destined for the celestial treasury,
its hoard unmatched.
Whole in body, light and swift,
free of cunning or artifice.
The net of dharma, the dust of passion—both undone.
Should one ascend the jeweled summit, seeking counsel,
this is not permitted—
no trafficking in the mortal realm.

**Fifth Stanza**
Heaven’s true, numinous seed,
a dream of *Huaxu*—
what use to ask of men?
The dark pearl, sealed in the celestial treasury,
vowed never to flaunt in the red dust.
Demonic hosts clamor in unison,
their voices rising and falling—
let them take their pomp and reverence.

chunks.original_text: 金毛披着上场来，却忘了、如山不动。 其六 妻男铁锁，家绿猛火。 煎迫猖狂怎么。 蝇头蜗角有多来，便舍命、争人竞我。 执迷不越，甘心笼裹。 黑谜猜他不破。 只须阎老帖来勾，待不得、儿孙长大。 其七 曲钩鱼闹，直钩无钓。 今古分明知道。 世情看假尽成真，总不识、先天至宝。 孤光圆照，相忘同调。 物物俱休逆料。 本来一点上通天，向姑射、山中笑傲。 其八 一团奸俏，一团性气。 动处欺天昧地。 伤他利己损生灵，广作业、交谁代替。 冥司断制，如何回避。 不许强辞抵讳。 头皮换却不如今，受苦楚、何时出离。 其九 灵源春渚，芝兰药圃。 发我归心雩舞。 玉堂金室隐云霞，才信及望目霄有路。 瑶台琼岛，珠林琪树。 香霭神风引步。 几回海上看桃花，千岁裹、花开一度。 其十 阎板听诳，天真成妄。
chunks.translated_text:
**Sixth Stanza**
The golden-furred beast strides onto the stage,
yet forgets its mountain-like immutability.
Wife and sons—iron chains,
home and fields—raging wildfire.
How to endure such frenzied torment?
The fly’s head, the snail’s horn—how much can they yield?
Yet life is cast aside,
vying for self, contending for others.
Bound in delusion, never transcending,
willingly trapped in the cage.
The black riddle—none can unravel.
Soon Yama’s warrant will come to summon,
leaving no time for children and grandchildren to grow.

**Seventh Stanza**
The crooked hook stirs the waters,
the straight hook catches nothing—
ancient and modern know this truth.
Worldly affairs: the false is seen as real,
yet none recognize the primordial treasure.
Solitary radiance shines in perfect clarity,
forgotten in shared resonance.
All things cease to oppose or foretell.
From the original point, a path opens to heaven—
on Guye Mountain, one laughs in freedom.

**Eighth Stanza**
A mass of cunning,
a mass of temper—
every move deceives heaven, obscures earth.
Harming others for self, destroying lives,
amassing karma—who will bear it in their stead?
The underworld’s judgment is inescapable,
no plea or excuse permitted.
Better to change one’s ways now,
than to suffer torment—when will it end?

**Ninth Stanza**
The spring-fed source of the spirit,
orchid gardens, herb fields—
awakening my longing to return, dancing in the wind.
Jade halls and golden chambers hidden in clouds,
only then does one believe the path to the heavens exists.
Jasper terraces, jade isles,
pearl groves, gemstone trees—
fragrant mists and divine winds guide each step.
How many times has one gazed at the peach blossoms by the sea?
Once in a thousand years, the flowers bloom anew.

**Tenth Stanza**
The clapper’s lies are heard,
heaven’s truth becomes falsehood.

chunks.translated_text:
Those who delight in posturing with cunning schemes,
brandish the roar of "fierce fire" and "walking the void"—
yet all their tricks are mere flourishes
on the blockhead’s stage.
Little gain, much pretense,
displaying every artifice of a lifetime.
In the end, what meaning remains?
The Mystic Pearl and Vast Image—both lost.

**Eleventh Stanza**
*For the Great Abbot of the Sandalwood City*

Coming as if awake, departing as if in dream,
parting without a trace of sentiment.
Few words at the farewell,
only this caution: "Do not toy with human kindness."
A true master is to be revered,
chosen among the immortal realms.
Ride the iridescent simurgh, the golden phoenix,
to the Peach Banquet of Penglai’s high assembly—
far nobler than the clamor of the mortal world.

*Yunshan Ji, Scroll Five Concludes*

*(Note in Yuan woodblock edition: Below this, a preface reads: "Since my restless wanderings eastward, winding through the hills for over a decade, I have lost all trace of Shanyang. One day, my cousin—undaunted by the brambles—turned his gaze to the lotus pavilion, inquiring after our uncle’s well-being and the safety of the jade kin. Still disoriented, as if in a dream, I hastily composed this *Yuzhonghua* lyric to send to him.")*

*(Yuan carved edition titles this: "For the Great Abbot, While in Gongcheng.")*

*Yunshan Ji, Scroll Six—Lyrics*
*By Perfected Master of Constancy, Ji Zhizhen*

chunks.original_text: 太常引 夜深凝寂月明堂。 曳缕返魂香。 物我两相忘。 恍然在、清微帝乡。 眼前今古，世问藏谷，一例尽亡羊。 险处不堤防。 竞奔走、槐檀战场。 其二 满山风物一溪云。 猿鹤自为邻。 绝尽□ 软红尘。 向物外、安排此身。 药炉丹鼎，凤膏龙屑，烹炼玉华新。 游宴景长春。 要承当、方壶旧人。 其三 幻尘扰扰梦魂飞。 着脚履危机。 省后自惊疑。 猛跳出、樊笼制围。 草鞋华杖，素冠蓬鬓，箬笠与蓑衣。 云水任束西。 更管甚、人问是非。 其四 贤愚汲汲斗经营。 唯是利和名。 浑似弄潮人。 与千丈、风波竞争。 百年光景，一堆尘土，碌碌苦劳生。 回首问前程。 望极目、山河未平。 其五 红尘白首尚羁摩。 忙乱趁多歧。 走骨们行尸。 问来往、驱驰是谁。 一天风月，一溪云水，此处好柄迟。 说与更生疑。 似拚耳、偷铃自欺。 其六 人生弱丧自迷方。 来往恰如狂。 泥裹弄泥团。 竟不识、神珠夜光。 几多风雨，几回磨岁，争肯暂恫惶。 何处是家乡。 便，指与、疑心怎忘。 其七 化工幻出是非囊。 般递利名场。 痴子竞商量。 便迷却、家园故乡。 摧残冰雪，忧愁风雨，几度变炎冻。 一念果难忘。 受万劫、轮回自当。 其八 非僧非俗不求仙。 茅屋两三橡。 白石与清泉。 更谁问、桃源洞天。 一炉香火，一瓯春雪，浇灌争三田。 闲想谷神篇。 忽不觉、松梢月圆。
chunks.translated_text:
**Tai Chang Yin**

**I**
Deep night, congealed in stillness—moonlit hall.
Trailing threads of soul-returning incense,
things and self both forgotten.
Suddenly, I am in the Celestial Realm of Pure Subtlety.
Past and present before my eyes,
the world’s valleys and ravines—
all alike lose the sheep.
At peril’s edge, no guard is kept,
yet all rush to the battleground of locust and sandalwood.

**II**
Mountain brimming with wind and scene—a creek’s cloud.
Gibbons and cranes make their own neighbors,
far from the dust’s soft red.
Beyond things, I arrange this body.
Crucible and elixir tripod,
phoenix-fat and dragon-scales,
boil the jade blossoms anew.
Feasting and wandering in scenes of eternal spring,
I must take up the mantle of Penglai’s old ones.

**III**
Illusory dust swirls—dream-souls take flight.
Step lightly, tread on danger’s snare.
Awakened, I startle at myself,
leaping free from the cage’s confines.
Straw sandals and patterned staff,
plain cap and disheveled locks,
bamboo hat and palm-bark cloak.
Clouds and waters go east or west—
why care for the world’s right or wrong?

**IV**
Wise and foolish alike scurry, vying in schemes.
Only profit and fame matter,
like tide-riders in a thousand-foot
storm-wave contest.
A hundred years of light,
a mound of dust,
a life of toil and drudgery.
Turning to ask of the road ahead,
I gaze afar—mountains and rivers remain unlevelled.

**V**
Red dust, white hair—still bound and chafing.
Hurried and harried, chasing many forks,
walking corpses with clattering bones.
Ask who drives this coming and going?
A sky of wind and moon,
a creek of clouds and waters—
here is a fine place to dwell.
Telling this only deepens doubt,
like covering ears to steal a bell—self-deceit.

**VI**
Life’s frail bier strays from the true path.
Coming and going, just like madness,
molding mud balls in mud.
Yet never recognizing the luminous night-pearl.
How many storms,
how many grinding years—
who would pause in dread?
Where is home?
Point it out—
how can the doubting heart forget?

**VII**
Nature’s craft fashions a sack of right and wrong,
a marketplace of profit and fame.
Fools haggle endlessly,
losing even their homeland and native village.
Crushed by ice and snow,
vexed by wind and rain,
how many shifts from heat to cold?
A single thought is hard to forget—
enduring kalpas of samsara is only right.

**VIII**
Neither monk nor layman, not seeking immortality.
A thatched hut of two or three rafters,
white stones and clear springs.
Who else asks of Peach Blossom’s grotto-heaven?
One censer of incense,
one bowl of spring snow,
irrigating the three fields in contest.
Idle thoughts on the *Valley Spirit* chapter—
suddenly, I realize the pine-tip moon is full.

chunks.original_text: 其九 道人活计要清虚。 不受利名拘。 囊蠹一钱无。 似出水、圆荷进珠。 一瓢糊口，纳衣遮体，此外更何图。 高枕及华胥。 向物外、钧天曳倨。 其十 情知万事转头空。 颖脱出樊笼。 饮啄且从容。 更不问、三山五峰。 一丸丹药，一枝华杖，来往任西束。 随处有云朋。 尽出没、重玄道中。 鹧鸪天 云散风清雨后天，新荷擎露碎珠圆。 清泉汨汨流尘外，白石岩岩赖醉眠。 山色裹，水声边。 留连风月话重玄。 溪童欲问人问事，笑指漫空柳撒绵。 其二 画饼充准必也虚，刻舟求剑决然无。 痴心密数人遗契，妄念重寻兔守株。 先圣迩，古人书。 枇糠难作夜光珠。 万绿拂尽方知道，妙处那能说与渠。 其三
chunks.translated_text:
**IX**
The Daoist’s livelihood must be pure emptiness,
unbound by profit or fame.
Not a single coin in his moth-eaten purse—
like a lotus rising from water, pearls in its wake.
A gourd for sustenance,
a patched robe for modesty,
what else could he desire?
Pillowed high, he drifts into Huaxu’s dream,
beyond the world, reeling in heaven’s grandeur.

**X**
Knowing well all things turn to emptiness in the end,
he sheds his cage like a feather.
Eating and drinking at ease,
no longer inquiring of Three Mountains or Five Peaks.
A single elixir pill,
a flowering staff in hand,
he roams east and west as he pleases.
Wherever he goes, cloud companions abound,
all lost and found within the Mystery upon Mystery’s Way.

---

**Partridge Sky**

After clouds disperse and wind stills, rain-cleared skies,
new lotuses lift dew—shattered pearls round.
A limpid spring gurgles beyond the dust,
white rocks stand stark, propping drunken slumber.

Mountain hues enfold,
waterside murmurs linger.
Lingering in wind and moonlight, we speak of the Mystery upon Mystery.
The brook boy asks of worldly affairs—
laughing, I point to willows scattering catkins across the boundless sky.

**II**
Painting cakes to sate hunger is but delusion,
carving a boat to seek a sword is surely futile.
Foolish hearts pore over others’ lost covenants,
mad thoughts chase hares or guard stumps anew.

The sages are near,
the ancients’ books remain.
Chaff cannot be made into luminous pearls.
Only when all green is swept away does one grasp the Way—
how could such subtlety be spoken to them?

**III**

chunks.translated_text:
**IV**
Emeralds woven, crimson cut—an old garden overflows,
endless flowers and trees contend in dazzling display.
The binding wind will not permit this to endure;
abandoning the old, it seizes the new with cunning sway.

Blossoms litter the earth,
willow fluff scatters the sky.
Tender green fruits swell, leaves veiled in mist.
Unfeeling, it defies the workings of the world’s schemes—
sitting, we watch the branches shift through countless changes.

**V**
Dusk falls, dawn blooms—trees but briefly flourish,
round lotuses rise from water, dew-pearls spill.
Fiery clouds stretch a thousand fathoms, scorching the heavens,
sweat-rain pours in weary, stifling steam.

In the Chamber of Empty Whiteness,
reciting the *Huangting*.
A breeze stirs, bearing lingering coolness.
Sitting, we watch Creation idly at play—
the fevered troubles of floating life never cease.

**VI**
Golden chrysanthemums by sparse fences flaunt Nature’s craft,
grass insects chirp softly, murmuring autumn’s visage.
Lotus withers, duckweed ages, reed flowers whiten,
the west wind stirs, scattering crimson leaves in disarray.

Mountains grow gaunt,
waters vie for dominance.
All ten thousand beings, driven and hurrying, return to the Source.
The Daoist rejoices too in the Three Worms’ demise—
through sleepless nights in the Crimson Palace, he sits.

**VII**
Frost and snow, stark and relentless—all things wither,
unable to endure the long night’s bitter, endless stretch.
Nature’s work hastens the return to primal mandate,
the Year’s Power turns its mechanism to nurture the Great Return.

The earth’s axis coils,
the celestial gate stands firm.
Jade seals, jeweled isles, and the Three Mountains.
True immortals pay no heed to the world’s affairs—
how often have they seen the yellow dust dry the azure sea?

chunks.original_text: 门外黄尘点沆人，山童不敢启云 扃。 石坛清坐神游北，径及无何接玉京。 香蔼蔼，气盈盈。 蟠蛟飞凤会云朋。 自倾碧酒重玄饮，醉裹乘风下太清。 其八 造物儿童作剧狂，悬丝傀儡戏当场。 般神弄鬼翻腾用，走骨行尸昼夜忙。 非是梅，利名乡。 青蝇白螳自相伤。 随声逐色谁敲点，拍手归来笑一场。 其九 千匝迷绳不自由，区区分外苦追求。 心中元本无烦恼，闹处先争要出头。 增我相，替人愁。 功名未了鬓先秋。 二莫防风激游丝断，撒手归空万事休。 其十 事事无心恰到闲，黄尘阐外不相干。 机多着网因名缚，无服吞钩被口馒。 樊物外，水云闲。 不劳辛苦运枢环。 藉莎白石和衣卧，野乌山猿相对看。 其十－ 弱丧飘流未肯归，玄关说与更增迷。 此行若遇商丘老，拚却骷髅更不疑。 先犯早，后迟迟。 个中消息几人知。 束风不解传春信，李白桃红自满枝。 其十二
chunks.translated_text:
**VIII**
Beyond the gate, yellow dust stains the sojourner,
the mountain lad dares not unbar the cloud-sealed door.
On the stone altar, in pure repose, the spirit roams north—
directly reaching the Void, it joins Jade Capital’s throng.
Fragrant mists swirl,
qi brims full.
Coiled dragons and soaring phoenixes gather in cloud-fellowship.
Pouring emerald wine, he drinks again of the Profound Mystery—
drunk, he rides the wind down from Great Purity.

**IX**
The Maker’s child plays in wild, capricious sport,
marionettes dance on silk strings across the stage.
Deities and ghosts are toyed with, tumbling in use—
walking corpses and running bones scurry day and night.
Not the plum’s domain,
but the realm of fame and gain.
Green flies and white mantises wound one another.
Who marks the toll of chasing sound and form?
Clapping hands, he returns, laughing at the scene.

**X**
A thousand coils of delusive rope—no freedom,
pettily, with toil, he pursues the extraneous.
Yet the heart’s origin holds no vexation—
in the clamor, he first contends to stand foremost.
Adding to my form,
taking on others’ sorrows.
Before merit is complete, his temples frost in autumn.
Twice, the wind of *fangfeng* snaps the drifting silk—
letting go, returning to emptiness, all things cease.

**XI**
In all things, without intent, he attains true leisure,
beyond the dusty gate, affairs no longer concern him.
Crafty nets ensnare through fame’s bonds,
no hook can deceive the mouth that swallows none.
Beyond the world’s cage,
water and clouds idle.
No need to toil at the pivot’s turning.
Lying on white stones amid the sedge, clothed as he is,
wild birds and mountain apes gaze back in shared regard.

**XII**
Weak and adrift, he refuses to return,
the Mystic Pass explained only deepens his confusion.
If on this journey he meets the Old Man of Shangqiu,
he’ll cast aside his skull without hesitation.
First, he errs in haste,
then lags behind.
Who knows the message within?
The east wind fails to carry spring’s tidings—
peach blossoms and plum’s white bloom fill the branches on their own.

chunks.translated_text:
**XIII**
With human artifice ever expanding, days grow long,
lightly they squander time, heedless of its cost.
Schemes in endless variety breed boundless sorrow,
a hundred cares wear him down, suffering unbearable.
His heart oppressed,
frost invades his temples.
Across the vast earth, he vainly chases fame.
Words he utters fill the cloth sack with silk,
but all the world sees is gold when they look upon him.

**XIV**
To save himself, he forgets the mad heart and worldly passions,
from mutual reproach he emerges clear as ice.
When men ask of the end, he ceases to count,
walking beyond things, his eyes grow bright on their own.
Mountains hushed,
waters pure and cold.
The sky filled with the bright moon, sparse stars.
The wind in the pines—his true friend—
nightly calls forth the myriad sounds’ song.

**XV**
The households vying for the deer remain lost in dreams,
all before their eyes is but dust and grime.
The traces of ancients—mere words, nothing more,
where now are the merits and fame of past lives?
The moon’s cave,
a heap of scattered prayers.
All their clamorous chatter is best left unheeded.
A single draught of rosy dawn grants three thousand days of drunkenness—
heed not the red wheel’s rise and fall.

chunks.translated_text:
**XVI**
Trading bones through myriad lives,
in the crucible’s torment, jagged and grim.
A hundred years pass, yet the wart and wen fade not,
a thousand ages, yet the whale’s maw cannot still.
Then waves surge,
the heart’s war arises.
The deluded rope binds itself, heaping sorrow’s citadel.
How many times has muddied water doused the breast?
Inverted words, topsy-turvy speech—hail the Great Peace.

**XVII**
Light through the crack spurs death’s relentless haste,
this floating life—how many fingers count its span?
The mustard-seed city’s karmic seeds near brimful,
brushing stone, parting clouds—yet the fog will not clear.
Merit lays the foundation,
sin vies for primacy.
Heroes, laid bare, crumble to ash and dust.
A ball of empty illusion idly tossed—
ears like the deaf, no call reaches through.

**XVIII**
Forsaking the world, I thought to dwell in mountains,
yet when men ask, I cannot stay idle.
Friends press close, thrusting me from my place,
the drum’s beat and clapper’s call drive me up the pole.
No leverage,
no turning back.
All mock—where is peace to be found?
Kindness, once applied, twists to malice,
warm breath, once blown, turns to chill.

**XIX**
The Supreme Polarity’s mystery—clear as a mirror,
heaven and earth are but forms within its glass.
Within the body’s shadow, shadows multiply,
in the name of things, names nest anew.
Things beyond emptiness,
judged in dreams.
A ball of empty illusion—play of luminous clarity.
The unwise take life as real,
striving in dreams to grasp the void.
chunks.overlap_context:
he wind in the pines—his true friend—
nightly calls forth the myriad sounds’ song.

**XV**
The households vying for the deer remain lost in dreams,
all before their eyes is but dust and grime.
The traces of ancients—mere words, nothing more,
where now are the merits and fame of past lives?
The moon’s cave,
a heap of scattered prayers.
All their clamorous chatter is best left unheeded.
A single draught of rosy dawn grants three thousand days of drunkenness—
heed not the red wheel’s rise and fall.

**To the Tune of Linjiangxian**

**I**
The world in tumult chases wealth and rank,
the Daoist alone claims pure poverty.
In pure poverty, soft and weak, he finds repose—
his heart at ease, passing days without affair,
content in fate, delighting in true nature.

A speck of vast integrity, bright as an ancient mirror,
perfectly clear, untouched by the slightest dust.
When merit’s full protection is complete, he communes with spirits,
transcends the triple realms,
and roams through spring’s four seasons.

**II**
Years and months, pitiless, turn swift as lightning,
a human life cannot endure such grinding away.
The road ahead is perilous—do not waste time.
Within a thousand-fathom pit of fire,
leap free to climb the lofty quilt.

Seek instead a place of pure cold, secure and steady,
sweep away the winds and waves of level ground.
Without shifting a single step, arrive at Nothing-What.
A flute without holes,
a song of Great Peace.

**III**
I am by nature a useless thing in this world,
having forgotten every skill and artifice.
For ten years, ice and snow—sitting in an empty hall.
The pull of human feelings stirs,
and I cannot hide my juggling.

Then I recall seeking secluded peaks and cloud-wrapped mountains,
building a thatched hut—what harm in small reclusion?
A bamboo study, a pine-lined path, twice as pure and cold.
Beyond a thousand cicadas, moonlight shines,
and wind stirs the fragrance of a hundred flowers.

**IV**
Brewing the wine of long life in heaven’s vault,
who in this world knows its savor?
A jade flask swiftly filled with azure glass.
Sipping it often, in small draughts,
the spirit’s radiance forgets fatigue.

A fine gathering of friends beyond the dusty world,
sharing fire dates and exchanged pears.
How many times has the azure sea turned to flying dust?
On the day of returning to the Three Mountains,
hand in hand, we step upon the clouds.

**V**
I laugh at the idle tricks upon my tongue—
words, after all, are never true.
Had I known sooner, I would have brushed away the dust from my tongue’s tip.
Three seals keep me ever silent,
transcending the ford of right and wrong.

Banishing a thousand demons and ten thousand trials,
in stillness I suddenly perceive the nourishing of spirit.
Fine winds and bright moons draw near of themselves.
Lifetimes of green habits severed,
I verify the original person.

**VI**

The play of self and other, right and wrong—
a puppet show, all hollow clamor
that deafens the ear to emptiness.
Forced divisions of Hu and Han,
painted paths east and west.

See through it: none of this is real.
What differs from a mad wind brushing the face?
Standing before it, one echoes the same.
This is no way to settle the self—
take up the mantle of the true host.

**Ten Thousand Spring Years**

A dream drifts to Huaxu,
palaces mid-heaven beyond mortal dust.
Strange fragrance wafts, ethereal,
trailing clouds and rosy dawn.
Vast and boundless, the spirit’s void—
eternal radiance, bright as noonday.
Who understands?
With you, I know the Dao:
through endless kalpas, spring never ages.

**II**

Arising and ceasing, without feeling,
ancient and modern turn like level water.
Hasten to prepare—
make plans for the journey ahead.
From the primal beginning,
that single point was never apart.
Peerless in spirit,
refine the true form,
and lifespan equals heaven and earth.

**III**

Cloud seas of Penglai,
jade forests and coral trees—true seed of immortals.
Rainbow phoenixes, golden simurghs
come and go in welcome.
Told to the world,

Mortal cares weigh heavy,
countless as ox hairs,

Cast off the worldly tether, unshackled—

All mortal ties severed, the world’s ways forgotten,

That original point abides in constant peace.

Everywhere, seek only true freedom.
Who would sell themselves for gain?
No idle spirits, no ghosts or demons,
no obstructions in form.
Why trouble with incense or fruit offerings?

No tricks, no folly or confusion,
the splendor of the world seen as a dream.
